questions.text: From what Marx Brothers movie was the fictional country Freedonia?
questions.explanation:
Duck Soup.

	Freedonia is a fake country made up for the 1933 movie, "Duck Soup". Congressman Santos mentioned a question was asked during a New Jersey debate about the situation in Freedonia and the candidate said he was looking into it.

questions.text: Did Santos put an attack ad on TV?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Josh had one ready and Santos didn't like it so he went to the TV station and did a live one-minute ad. In Santos live one-minute ad he said, "Good evening. I'm running for President and if you don't know know who I am, I wouldn't be surprised. I've been shut out of tomorrow night's debate for suggesting that it actually be a debate and this is the only ad I can afford.I got in this to improve a broken school system, to fix entitlement because they're going bankrupt, to expand health coverage because it will save money if fewer people in up in emergency rooms. What I found is that Presidential campaigns aren't about these things.They're about clawing your opponents eyes out as long as you don't get tagged for it. So how about this: I will never say anything about my opponents, or anything about anything, without saying it myself, right into the camera. You might not get to hear much of me, but when you do, you'll know I stand by it. I'm Matt Santos and you better believe I approve this ad."

questions.text: As they were getting on the campaign bus, who did Russell say could have Will's job?
questions.explanation:
Josh.

	When the Vice President made the remark to Will, Donna told both of them that right now she thought Josh would take the job.

questions.text: Did Josh call Amy and ask for help in prepping Santos for a debate?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Santos told Josh that he called someone in to help him prepare for a debate. Josh didn't find out until later that it was Amy and before that he had taken credit for calling someone in to help Santos prepare for a debate.

questions.text: Where was Vice President Russell when he was approached by Chicken Bob?
questions.explanation:
Hockey game.

	Josh sent two men in chicken suits, one with a Chicken John and one with a Chicken Bob shirt, to approach the men and ask if they were chicken to have a real debate with all the candidates. Donna chased after Chicken Bob and yelled at him on national television.

questions.text: Out of the seven democratic candidates, who were the only two candidates chosen to have a debate?
questions.explanation:
Russell and Hoynes.

	Josh referred to the seven candidates as the seven dwarfs, but his assistant told him that only two candidates were chosen for the debate and they were Vice President Russell and former Vice President Hoynes.

questions.text: Who called Josh and told him he should have taught Donna never to engage a chicken?
questions.explanation:
CJ.

	CJ saw it on the news and called Josh while she was watching it. President Santos asked Josh later on why he saw a chicken on the news.

questions.text: Who did Donna make this comment to? "Everyone else in this campaign is fourteen years old and irons their blue jeans."
questions.explanation:
Will.

	On the bus, Donna and Will were discussing how they always have dinner together because everyone else is involved in the campaign is younger than they are.

questions.text: How did Amy keep Josh sitting down to watch the news coverage?
questions.correct: She taped him to the chair
options: By starting to do a striptease
questions.explanation:
She taped him to the chair.

	Amy wanted Josh to sit still for one minute and watch the news coverage that Santos garnered. The only way she could get him to sit still was by taping him to the chair. Later, when Santos asked where Josh had been, Josh said he got tied up.

questions.text: Did Amy stay to watch the new debate with all seven candidates?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Josh offered to buy her an ice cream cone after the debate, but she had to leave to get ready for her flight home. Josh watched her leave and then he went back to watching the debate.
